question: 1. (001) Light fixtures are classified by
options: a. the way they distribute light.
b. the way they are installed.
correct: a. the way they distribute light.

question: 2. (001) Which light classification directs from 40 to 60 percent of its light upward above the area to be lighted?
3. (001) Which classification of light fixture directs all its light so that the entire ceiling and upper side walls become the light source?

5. (001) The efficiency range of a lamp is measured in lumens per
6. (002) Incandescent lamps have efficiencies ranging from
7. (002) What is the diameter of a T8 lamp?

9. (002) What is used to power a light emitting diode (LED) array in a non-integrated LED fixture?
10. (003) What is a disadvantage of high-intensity discharge (HID) lamps?
options: a. Low lumen per watt output.

question: 11. (003) What are the voltages that the 150-watt high-pressure sodium (HPS) lamp comes in?
12. (003) What color light is associated with high-pressure sodium (HPS) lamps?
13. (004) Which type of fixture is installed by laying it into the grid of a suspended ceiling?
14. (004) When installing an octagon box for a new flush mount fixture what is important to ensure that the mounting method does not fail?
options: a. Box is sized to support the fixture.
b. The fixture is less than 10 pounds.
c. Fixture is secured using sheetrock screws.
d. Fill capacity of the box to allow enough space for connections.
correct: a. Box is sized to support the fixture.

question: 15. (005) What are the two types of phase cut dimmers?
options: d. Single pole and double pole.

question: 16. (005) How does a phase cut dimmer operate?
options: a. A variable resistor is used to lower the voltage.
b. Two or more resistors are used to form a voltage divider.
c. The root mean square (RMS) voltage is reduced by turning off a portion of the input waveform.
d. Semiconductor switches are used to turn off only the negative portion of the input waveform.
correct: c. The root mean square (RMS) voltage is reduced by turning off a portion of the input waveform.

question: 17. (005) What is the light output of a fixture using a 0-10V ballast with 10 volts on the low voltage control circuit?
18. (006) What type of light fixture is typically used to illuminate aircraft on the parking apron?
19. (006) In an incandescent lamp, how much consumed energy is lost in the form of heat?
20. (006) What device is used in high-intensity discharge (HID) lamps to limit current as the lamp heats up?
21. (006) What letter represents the American National Standards Institute's special designation code for high-pressure sodium (HPS) lamps?
22. (007) When installing fixtures, ensure uniform lighting by
options: a. using only mercury vapor fixtures.
b. adjusting fixtures to 5º from horizontal.
c. using only high-pressure sodium fixtures.
d. adjusting fixtures so that illuminated areas overlap.
correct: d. adjusting fixtures so that illuminated areas overlap.

question: 23. (007) To ensure that the proper amount of light is provided after fixture installation, check the lighting with
24. (007) When troubleshooting a 120-volt photocell, which conductor should provide power to the light fixture?

options: d. do all of the above tasks.
correct: d. do all of the above tasks.

question: 26. (008) Which airfield lights have yellow filters installed for the last 2,000 feet of runaway?
27. (008) Which airfield lights provide positive identification of the beginning of the operational runway surface for approaching aircraft?

30. (008) What color is used for the taxiway edge light?
31. (009) One of the main control panels for the airfield lights is in the vault; where is the other panel located?

options: a. An extra master sequence panel.
b. An extra power supply module.
correct: b. An extra power supply module.

question: 33. (010) The standard control cable for an airfield lighting control system has how many conductors?
34. (010) Which airfield vault device is used to swap location of control of the airfield lights?
35. (010) What size cable is used for airfield light field circuits?
36. (011) How are the output leads of an airfield regulator labeled?
37. (011) What size counterpoise is used for airfield lighting circuits?
38. (011) What must be done before replacing an isolating (IL) transformer?
options: a. Apply two half-lapped layers of tape to the connectors.
b. Call the electrical superintendent for clearance.
c. Cut the ends off of the old IL transformer.
d. De-energize, tag, and ground the circuit.
correct: d. De-energize, tag, and ground the circuit.

question: 39. (011) What feature is common to elevated airfield lights?
options: a. They use a higher wattage lamp than other lights.
b. They use a lower wattage lamp than other lights.
c. They are built with frangible construction.
d. They are sturdier than semiflush lights.
correct: c. They are built with frangible construction.

question: 40. (012) The primary purpose of the rotating/airport beacon is to
options: a. mark the highest airfield obstruction.
b. inform pilots of their altitude.
d. guide the pilot to the airfield.
correct: d. guide the pilot to the airfield.

question: 41. (012) How many revolutions per minute (RPM) does the airport beacon turn?

options: a. A buzzer is activated in the tower.
b. A signal light in the vault is activated.
c. Base operations initiates an emergency service call.
d. A reserve lamp is placed in operation automatically.
correct: d. A reserve lamp is placed in operation automatically.

question: 43. (012) What voltage is necessary to run the airport beacon?

options: b. The beacon motor's tap block.
c. The tap changer in the distribution transformer.
d. The constant-current regulator that feeds the beacon circuit.
correct: c. The tap changer in the distribution transformer.

options: a.Any time system is turned on.
b.When system is in stand-by mode.
c.When system is operated on high intensity.
d.When system is operated on medium intensity.
correct: c.When system is operated on high intensity.

question: 51.(014) What would indicate a failure condition on the lightning protection varistors?

options: a.Excessive dirt accumulation on the lens.

question: 54. (016) After notifying the control tower, what should you do before working on control circuits?
options: c. Test the circuit with an ohmmeter.
d. Open fused cutouts on transformer.

question: 55. (016) What indication is considered "good" when you read across a closed switch with a voltmeter?

57. (017) How are animals prevented from chewing on airfield lighting fixture cords?
options: a. Fixtures are designed so that no cords are exposed.
b. Using a yellow colored fixture to scare them away.
c. By applying pesticides to the fixture.
d. By energizing portions of the fixture.
correct: a. Fixtures are designed so that no cords are exposed.

question: 58. (017) What is used to maintain contact with the tower when away from the truck?
59. (017) What should you do just before screwing an elevated fixture coupling onto the base?
options: a. Tighten the lock-ring until it is fully seated to the base.
b. Twist the entire fixture clockwise several full rotations.
c. Loosen the lock-ring until it is completely free of the fixture.
d. Twist the entire fixture counterclockwise several full rotations.
correct: d. Twist the entire fixture counterclockwise several full rotations.

question: 60. (018) Which approach lighting system maintenance item must be performed daily?
options: c. Check and record burned out lamps.
d. Check and record secondary amperage readings.
correct: c. Check and record burned out lamps.

question: 61. (018) When should you check all approach light fixtures for alignment?
62. (019) Where is the precision approach path indicator (PAPI) system located?
options: c. On the left side of the runway.
d. On the right side of the runway.
correct: c. On the left side of the runway.

question: 63. (019) What occurs when a precision approach path indicator (PAPI) unit gets misaligned by more than ½ degree up or 1 degree down?
options: a. A buzzer sounds in the tower cab.
b. A tilt switch opens the entire circuit.
c. A warning light is turned on at the unit.
d. A warning light is turned on at the vault.
correct: b. A tilt switch opens the entire circuit.

question: 64. (020) How often are dielectric oil tests made on airfield regulators?
65. (020) When you tie together two airfield light circuits for emergency operation, what do you do to prevent regulator overload?
options: b. Remove every third airfield light from the new circuit.
c. Move the control wire from step 5 relay to step 4 relay.
d. Parallel the two circuits before you connect them to the regulator.
correct: c. Move the control wire from step 5 relay to step 4 relay.

question: 66. (021) What meter do you use to perform insulation resistance tests on airfield light circuits?

68. (021) In order to perform a direct current (DC) hi-potential test on an airfield light circuit, what do you do with the leads once you remove them from the airfield regulator?
options: c. Support one lead and ground the other.
d. Support both leads and keep them clear of each other and the ground.
correct: d. Support both leads and keep them clear of each other and the ground.

question: 69. (021) When using radios, which two words should you use to describe circuit conditions?

5. (203) What do all technical order (TO) indexes have as the first number?

correct: d. AFTO Form 22, Technical Manual (TM) Change Recommendation and Reply.

question: 7. (204) Which technical order (TO) improvement recommendation requires action within 40 days of its receipt?

correct: a. General overview listing the purpose, scope, and references for the UFC.

question: 11. (206) Who publishes the National Electric Code?

15. (207) An equipment ground is a grounding system that
options: a. stabilizes voltage between two or more metallic objects.
b. removes excess voltage from current carrying metallic objects.
c. drains off static electricity before a sparking potential is reached.
d. connects to earth all nonconcurrent carrying metal parts of an electrical wiring system.
correct: d. connects to earth all nonconcurrent carrying metal parts of an electrical wiring system.

question: 16. (207) What maximum ground resistance is the value for an electrical system with a voltage of 600 volts alternating current (VAC) or less?

c. Load side of service entrance and outlets.
d. Source side of service entrance and outlets.
correct: b. Source side of service entrance.

question: 19. (208) A system neutral conductor is likely grounded improperly (grounded on the load side of the service entrance disconnect), if the ohmic value is less than
20. (209) At what intervals should a wye-connected distribution system neutral be grounded?
options: a. At a distance not to exceed ¼ mile.
b. At a distance not to exceed ½ mile.
c. At a distance not to exceed 1 mile.
d. This system neutral is not grounded.
correct: a. At a distance not to exceed ¼ mile.

question: 21. (209) What recommended depth is the top of a ground rod driven for distribution pole grounding?
22. (210) The metal frame of a building can be used as a facility ground
options: a. if the frame is effectively grounded.
b. if the building is equipped with air terminals.
c. only when it is supported by insulated flanges.
d. only if the braces are separately bonded to the ground loop.
correct: a. if the frame is effectively grounded.

question: 23. (210) What are the requirements for a facility ground rod?
options: a. 4 feet long; copper-clad steel, solid copper, or galvanized steel.
b. 8 feet long; copper-clad steel, solid copper, or galvanized steel.
c. 4 feet long; copper-clad steel, solid copper, or stainless steel.
d. 8 feet long; copper-clad steel, solid copper, or stainless steel.
correct: d. 8 feet long; copper-clad steel, solid copper, or stainless steel.

question: 24. (210) Which is the minimum allowed resistance for an electrode used for communications network grounds?
25. (210) Isolated ground (IG) receptacles are used in circuits feeding electronic devices to
options: d. block high voltage generated from lightning strikes.

question: 26. (210) In an isolated ground (IG) receptacle, the
options: a. grounding pin is purposely insulated from the outlet box.
b. IG will be bonded to other grounds in the immediate area.
c. IG must have its own lightning arrester.
d. IG must have its own driven ground rod.
correct: a. grounding pin is purposely insulated from the outlet box.

question: 27. (211) What happens if a bare grounding wire touches the hot conductor terminal of a receptacle inside of a properly grounded outlet box?
options: a. Equipment plugged in the receptacle receives excessive current and overheats.
b. The neutrals for the entire facility become hot conductors.
c. The circuit breaker for that circuit trips.
d. The outlet voltage is doubled.
correct: c. The circuit breaker for that circuit trips.

question: 28. (211) Physical failure of grounding systems usually occurs in which portion of the system?
options: c. Just above and below ground level.
d. At the point where it attaches to the equipment.
correct: c. Just above and below ground level.

question: 29. (211) In an interior wiring system with metallic conduit, through how many possible paths can return ground fault flow?
30. (211) What test can you perform to ensure that the above grade components in a grounding system have a low resistance path to ground?
31. (212) What characteristics are the properties of good insulators?
options: a. Clean dry surfaces in low humidity; can hold their charge.
b. Clean dry surfaces in high humidity; can hold their charge.
c. Contaminated surfaces in low humidity; can hold their charge.
d. Clean dry surfaces in any humidity; permit leakage to take place.
correct: a. Clean dry surfaces in low humidity; can hold their charge.

question: 32. (212) What minimum sparking voltage is generally accepted for the shortest measurable length of gap?
33. (213) Under proper conditions, approximately how much voltage can be charged up by a drop of liquid falling through the air?

correct: d. Where it exits a structure.

b. To determine the unserviceability of some components required to impress current to the anodes of the impressed current system.
c. To determine the reliability of all components required to impress current to the anodes of the impressed current system.
d. To determine the compatibility of all components required to impress current to the anodes of the impressed current system.
correct: a. To determine the serviceability of all components required to impress current to the anodes of the impressed current system.

correct: d. Someone disables the fire suppression system.

question: 60. (223) Where in a facility will a pull station be located?

b. Near exits and in exit stairwells.
correct: b. Near exits and in exit stairwells.

options: a. The detectors "Talk" to the fire alarm control panel (FACP).
b. The FACP broadcasts messages to all the detectors.
c. The detectors relay messages to the FACP.
d. The same as in a conventional system
correct: a. The detectors "Talk" to the fire alarm control panel (FACP).

question: 67. (224) How are addressable detectors and modules assigned an address?
options: a. Device address is set when they are manufactured.
b. By turning two rotary switches on the device.
c. Setting "dip" switches on the device.
correct: b. By turning two rotary switches on the device.

correct: d. Perpetrators have been known to use the fire alarm system as a means of attack.

c. below the top of the pole.
correct: a. above the midpoint of the pole.

question: 21. (408) If a pole must be set in an energized line, what two additional articles of equipment must be used?

c. Pole guard and conductor spreader.

question: 26. (410) What factors are considered when establishing the three loading areas for conductors in theUnited States?

correct: d. Longitudinal, transverse, and vertical loading.

question: 52. (421) What is the device used to attach the underground cable to the pulling rope?
53. (422) Which procedure do you use to assure that a duct is clear of obstructions?
54. (422) Why is proper cable reel placement important?
options: a. Ensures bend in the cable is not reversed.
b. To allow the reel to be lubricated properly.
c. Ensures cable is installed in the correct duct.
d. Proper cable reel placement is not important.
correct: a. Ensures bend in the cable is not reversed.

question: 55. (422) How many people does it take to pull underground cable safely using the winch method?
56. (423) What term describes an underground cable that is brought up through a conduit and attached to an overhead line?
57. (423) The device used to terminate high-voltage cables is called a
58. (424) When making a load-break elbow, before attaching the crimp connector to the cable make sure you
options: a. clean the cable with alcohol.
b. apply corrosion inhibitor to the cable.
c. align the hole on the end of the connector with the equipment bushing.
d. apply semi-conducting tape to the conductor for the length of the elbow.
correct: c. align the hole on the end of the connector with the equipment bushing.

question: 59. (424) After sliding the elbow over the connector and cable the next step is to
options: a. attach the threaded electrode to the connector using a pair of adjustable pliers.
b. thread the electrode into the connector using the wrench from the elbow kit.
c. thread the electrode into the connector until it is hand tight.
d. crimp the electrode onto the connector.
correct: b. thread the electrode into the connector using the wrench from the elbow kit.

question: 60. (425) What depth do you dig the trench for a below-ground check of a pole?
61. (425) Decay usually starts at what location on a crossarm?
62. (425) What condition can cause a crossarm to twist?
options: c. Unbalanced strain or insufficient guying.
d. Crossarm unseasoned when it was installed.
correct: c. Unbalanced strain or insufficient guying.

question: 63. (426) When a span shows too much sag while adjacent spans appear normal,
options: a. the conductor has stretched from being hit by a falling object.
b. the cause is a twisted crossarm.
c. it's a sign of loose tie wires.
d. it's a result of poor guying.
correct: a. the conductor has stretched from being hit by a falling object.

question: 64. (426) We must make voltage and current readings on capacitor installations at least
65. (427) What do we use to cut tree limbs that are beyond arm's reach?
66. (427) Where would you put the tree pruner to add a third section?
options: a. Send it to the shop.
b. Lay it flat on the ground.
c. Lean it against a tree limb.
d. Lay it across the truck bed.
correct: c. Lean it against a tree limb.

question: 67. (427) What species of trees do we usually top?
68. (428) What is usually the first step in troubleshooting a tripped overhead distribution circuit?
options: d. Try to reset the circuit's recloser.

question: 69. (428) What do we use to test a distribution line for a ground?
70. (428) Which of these is not one of the three main causes of power line noise?
options: b. Bonded ground wires on the utility pole.
c. Electrostatic leakage from ungrounded hardware.
d. Loose connections in the primary or neutral circuit.
correct: b. Bonded ground wires on the utility pole.

question: 71. (429) What must the electrician do before working on deenergized lines?
options: b. Test and ground the lines.
c. Close the normally open switch.
correct: b. Test and ground the lines.

question: 72. (429) How is the cable used for ground sets constructed?
options: a. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.
b. 5,000-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.
c. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered hard-drawn copper.
d. 5,000-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered hard-drawn copper.
correct: a. 600-volts insulated rubber or synthetic-covered flexible copper.

question: 73. (430) When a break occurs in an energized line, how is the line at the break affected?
options: a. Both ends of the wire are melted.
b. Both ends of the wire are hardened.
c. The whole wire get very brittle and charred.
d. The center disappears, leaving soft wire on either side.
correct: d. The center disappears, leaving soft wire on either side.

question: 74. (430) What do you use to check a suspected damaged transformer?
75. (431) What must you do before working on energized lines?
options: a. Inspect the utility pole for heart-rot.
b. Fill out AF Form 980, Caution Abnormal Conditions tag.
c. Inspect hot line tools and equipment for proper operation.
d. Fill out AF Form 103, Base Civil Engineering Work Clearance Request.
correct: d. Fill out AF Form 103, Base Civil Engineering Work Clearance Request.

question: 76. (431) What two connector types do we use when splicing energized conductors?
options: c. Hot line clamp and split-bolt.
d. Compression and hot line clamp.

question: 77. (431) In making a midspan splice on an energized line, position the personnel bucket of the bucket truck
options: a. at a 45° angle to the break.
b. parallel to the area to be spliced.
c. directly under the area to be spliced.
d. so the linemen can face the splice area from the front of the bucket.
correct: d. so the linemen can face the splice area from the front of the bucket.

question: 78. (432) What tie stick head do we normally use to untie tie wires?
79. (432) Once we untie the tie wires what do we use to raise the auxiliary crossarm assembly?

81. (433) When replacing a pole, how many feet above the pole do you raise the auxiliary arm?
82. (433) The high voltage audible indicator makes an audible sound when placed
83. (434) The act of tying a tagline to each outside conductor with a bowline knot and pulling the conductors out of the work area is called
options: conductors out of the work area is called

question: 84. (434) After you remove the crossarm, who lowers it to the ground?
85. (435) Service meters are used to determine
options: a. if sufficient voltage is reaching a facility or organization.
b. how large a service is needed for a facility or organization.
c. if sufficient amperage is reaching a facility or organization.
d. how much power has been used by a facility or organization.
correct: d. how much power has been used by a facility or organization.

question: 86. (435) The service meter normally measures
87. (435) What is the formula to find the amount of watt-hours used?
options: c. Multiplier times the previous reading.
d. New reading minus the previous reading.
correct: d. New reading minus the previous reading.

question: 88. (435) When transposing the numbers from the dial meter to a piece of paper, start on the.
options: a. right hand dial then work to the left.
b. left hand dial then work to the right.
c. top dial then work to the bottom.
d. bottom dial then work to the top.
correct: a. right hand dial then work to the left.

question: 89. (436) What is the approximate bending radius for underground cable?
90. (436) How much straight cable needs to exist on each side of a cable splice for racking purposes?
91. (436) What type of tape is used for fireproofing underground cable in manholes?
92. (436) What type of cable test is made after its installed but before it is placed into service?
93. (436) Generally if a cable's insulation is deteriorating, what does a direct current high potential(DC Hypot) cable test indicate for each succeeding test?
options: a. Lower resistance or a lower power factor.
b. Lower resistance or a higher power factor.
c. Higher resistance or a lower power factor.
d. Higher resistance or a higher power factor.
correct: c. Higher resistance or a lower power factor.

question: 94. (437) What is the easiest and quickest way to locate a cable fault?
95. (437) When you check for a grounded conductor with a volt-ohmmeter, what reading would indicate a grounded conductor?
96. (437) When you use the mm-1 fault locator or the thumper to locate a cable fault, when you are over the fault location
options: a. the signal increases with both testers.
b. the signal decreases with both testers.
c. fault locator signal increases at the fault; thumper signal decreases.
d. fault locator signal fades out at the fault; thumper signal increases to the loudest volume.
correct: c. fault locator signal increases at the fault; thumper signal decreases.

question: 97. (438) In many cases, a cable fault is located at a
98. (438) Which cable splice kit requires the most labor to install?
99. (439) What should be your first step when troubleshooting a pad mount transformer?
options: a. Take a complete set of secondary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.
b. Take a complete set of primary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.
c. Take phase-to-phase voltage readings on the secondary side of the transformer.
d. Take phase-to-ground voltage readings on the primary side.
correct: a. Take a complete set of secondary phase-to-phase and phase-to-ground voltage readings.

question: 100. (439) If tests indicate an off-ratio winding, how would you verify whether or not the problem was in the transformer?
options: a. Take primary current readings on all three phases.
b. Take secondary current readings on all three phases.
c. Take voltage readings on the primary side of the transformer.
d. De-energize the transformer and take resistance readings on the transformer windings.
correct: c. Take voltage readings on the primary side of the transformer.

question: 1. (601) What is the next step in installing strobe lights after you ground the series circuit adapter and master strobe?
options: a. Set the on-off switches to the on position.
b. Set the strobe master switch to remote.

question: 2. (601) What is the TAG's first step in installing the strobe units?
options: a. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces away from the runway.
b. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces toward the runway.
c. Position the series circuit adapter (SCA) next to the strobe slave.
d. Connect the strobe unit to the SCA.
correct: a. Position the strobe master unit so that its window faces away from the runway.

question: 3. (601) What is the next step after the TAG installs the 1000 foot crossbar?
options: a. Go back to the outboard strobe location and install it.
b. Go directly to the threshold and position the lights.
c. Position the inboard strobe slave unit.

question: 4. (601) What is the final step in installing the runway edge lights?
options: a. Connect the fixture to an isolation transformer.
b. Connect the fixture to the rest of the airfield circuit.
c. Install an isolation transformer inboard of the fixture.
d. Anchor each light fixture with two ballast rings or one stake.
correct: d. Anchor each light fixture with two ballast rings or one stake.

question: 5. (601) What do you do first when leveling and aiming a precision approach path indicator (PAPI)unit?
options: a. Level the unit from side to side by adjusting the unit's two front knobs.
b. Level the unit from front to back by adjusting the unit's rear knob.
c. Adjust the aim of the unit to provide a 3-degree glide slope.
d. Adjust the PAPI unit's tilt switch.
correct: a. Level the unit from side to side by adjusting the unit's two front knobs.

question: 6. (601) What is the final step in installation of the precision approach path indicator (PAPI) units?
options: a. Install a photocell on either unit.
b. Stake each unit securely to the ground.
c. Align each unit so that it is parallel with the runway.
d. Adjust the tilt switch so that the bubble is in the middle.
correct: d. Adjust the tilt switch so that the bubble is in the middle.

question: 7. (601) How do you begin the procedure for installing the emergency airfield lighting system obstruction lights?
options: a. Install the batteries into the fixture.
b. Connect the fixture straight into the runway circuit.
c. Connect the fixture to the runway circuit through a transformer.
d. Connect the fixture to the runway circuit through a series circuit adapter (SCA).
correct: a. Install the batteries into the fixture.

question: 8. (602) When performing an open circuit test on the regulator, what is the next step after turning the circuit breaker off?
options: a. Turn the intensity selector switch to the OFF position.
b. Turn the intensity selector switch to the LOW intensity setting.
c. Install the male-to-male adapter cable into the output current plugs.
d. Remove the male-to-male adapter cable from the output current plugs.
correct: d. Remove the male-to-male adapter cable from the output current plugs.

question: 9. (603) When replacing a lamp on a runway edge light, how do you remove the lamp from its base?
options: a. Grip the lamp by its ceramic base and pull straight up.
b. Turn the lamp in a counter-clockwise direction.
c. Loosen the screws holding the lamp in place.
d. Turn the lamp in a clock-wise direction.
correct: a. Grip the lamp by its ceramic base and pull straight up.

question: 10. (603) How do you remove the red lens from an obstruction light?
options: a. Unscrew the lens in a clock-wise direction.
b. Unscrew the lens in a counter-clockwise direction.
c. Remove the screws holding the lens in place and pull the lens straight up.
d. Loosen the screws holding the lens in place, turn it to the right, and pull it straight up.
correct: d. Loosen the screws holding the lens in place, turn it to the right, and pull it straight up.

question: 11. (603) Which of the following is a step in the process of changing out a lamp in a strobe unit?
options: a. Disconnect the fixture from the series circuit adapter.
b. Disconnect the fixture from the airfield circuit.
c. Connect the fixture's case to ground.

question: 12. (603) What is the procedure for removing the electrical connection from a precision approach path indicator (PAPI) lamp?
options: a. Loosen the terminal screw and remove the connection from the lamp.
b. Push in the connector and turn it counterclockwise.
c. Pull the connection straight back off the lamp.
d. Push in the connector and turn it clockwise.
correct: b. Push in the connector and turn it counterclockwise.

question: 13. (604) What generator is used for emergency backup of facilities that are mission essential, such as communications centers and command posts?
14. (605) Besides conductor size, what is another important factor to consider when reducing voltage drop in an electrical circuit?

15. (605) You have a #8 AWG stranded copper conductor with 0.778 ohms of resistance for each1,000 feet of length. If you run that cabling 100 feet between the power plant and the load, the total resistance would be
16. (606) How do you start the engine of a mission essential power (MEP) 806B generator?
options: a. Turn on ENGINE CONTROL switch.
b. Close the ENGINE CONTROL switch.
c. Close the ENGINE CONTROL circuit breaker.
d. Hold ENGINE CONTROL switch in the START for 2 seconds.
correct: d. Hold ENGINE CONTROL switch in the START for 2 seconds.

question: 17. (606) What is the first step to shutting down a generator?
options: b. Place ENGINE CONTROL switch in the OFF position.
c. Select SHUTDOWN COMPUTER on CIM display screen.
d. Hold alternating current (AC) CIRCUIT INTERRUPT switch in OPEN position to open the load contactor.
correct: d. Hold alternating current (AC) CIRCUIT INTERRUPT switch in OPEN position to open the load contactor.

question: 18. (607) When operating in extremely cold climates, what must you do to prevent the battery from freezing when you add water?
options: a. Reposition the battery closer to the engine.
b. Use a weak salt solution to fill the battery.
c. Immediately mix the fluid by charging the battery.
d. Do not add fluid when below freezing temperatures are expected.
correct: c. Immediately mix the fluid by charging the battery.

question: 19. (608) The Basic Expeditionary Airfield Resources Order of Battle (BOB) is based on increments on of how many personnel?
20. (608) On a 25-kw power distribution panel (PDP), what is the 60-amp output utilized for?
options: b. This PDP does not have 60-amp output.
c. Backfeed connection from the secondary distribution panel (SDC).
d. To connect a field deployable environmental control unit (FDECU).
correct: d. To connect a field deployable environmental control unit (FDECU).

question: 21. (609) How many light masts come with the remote area lighting system (RALS)?

29. (611) What is used to ground the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU)?
options: a. The contact between the earth and the frame of the unit is a sufficient ground.
b. A three-piece ground rod that is stored on the control panel.
c. A ¾ inch ground rod that is 10 feet in length.
d. A 10 foot metal discharge pipe.
correct: b. A three-piece ground rod that is stored on the control panel.

question: 30. (611) What safety precaution should be taken prior to disconnecting any pipes or equipment on the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU)?
options: b. Open all drains and vents.
c. Turn off chemical feed pumps.
d. Prime the reverse osmosis pump.
correct: b. Open all drains and vents.

question: 31. (611) Where is the reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU) ground rod stored?
options: a. Under the circuit breaker box.

question: 32. (612) Which contingency asset requires two dedicated secondary distribution centers (SDC) to meet its high load demands?
options: c. Reverse osmosis water purification unit (ROWPU).
d. Basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) kitchen.
correct: d. Basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) kitchen.

question: 33. (612) The basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) kitchen is powered by two generators,one 60 kW and one
34. (612) When operating how often is the basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) kitchen electrical system inspected?

38. (614) Which way point is used to tie two primary switching centers (PSC) together?

40. (614) What is used to compensate for voltage drop in a secondary distribution center (SDC)?
41. (614) What is the conductor size and insulation value of the basic expeditionary airfield resources(BEAR) high-voltage electrical cable?
42. (614) You should bury primary cables to a depth of at least
43. (614) How many ways on the primary switching center (PSC) have load interrupter switches?
44. (614) Before performing maintenance on the secondary distribution center (SDC) you
options: a. shut down the primary switching center (PSC).
b. close the mission essential power breaker.
c. contact the disaster control center.
d. ensure all power is removed.
correct: d. ensure all power is removed.

question: 45. (614) What is the mostly likely problem when there is no power to any of the outbound primary distribution center feeders?
46. (615) The recommended distance for secondary runs from the secondary distribution center(SDC) is not to exceed
47. (615) What basic expeditionary airfield resources (BEAR) asset is used as the main distribution point for secondary circuits?
48. (615) How many 120/208 volts alternating current output circuits can the secondary distribution center (SDC) provide?
49. (615) Which power distribution panel is associated with the tent extendible modular personnel(TEMPER) tent?
50. (615) What cable size is used to connect the low-voltage mission essential power generator to the secondary distribution center (SDC)?
51. (615) How do you de-energize the transformer windings of one secondary distribution center(SDC) without de-energizing any of the interconnected SDCs?
options: a. Turn off the main circuit breaker.
b. Pull the three fused disconnects in the high-voltage compartment.
c. De-energize the main feeder at the primary switching center (PSC).
d. Disconnect the load-break elbows in the high-voltage compartment.
correct: b. Pull the three fused disconnects in the high-voltage compartment.

question: 52. (616) What can you do to ground the system if the ground rod cannot be driven into the earth during deployments to locations where low voltage will be used for a short time?
options: a. Connect generator ground to system neutral.
b. Bury the ground rod in a horizontal trench that is 18 inches deep.
c. No grounds are required for low-voltage short-time deployments.
d. Drive the ground rod in as far as it will go, and cut off the excess.
correct: b. Bury the ground rod in a horizontal trench that is 18 inches deep.

question: 53. (616) What mixture of salt and water normally increases the conductivity of the soil that is in contact with a ground rod?
options: a. 1 pound of salt per 1 gallon of water.
b. 1 pound salt per 3 gallons of water.
c. 3 pounds of salt per 1 gallon of water.
d. 3 pounds of salt per 5 gallons of water.
correct: c. 3 pounds of salt per 1 gallon of water.

question: 54. (617) How many light streamers are installed in each tent?
55. (617) When dissembling the tent lighting assets, where do you store the components?
options: a. In the proper storage containers.
b. In an approved cargo container.
c. In the middle of the tent.
correct: a. In the proper storage containers.
